lines.text: [the kids aren't thrilled about being named the Ducks]
I didn't have a choice, we're being sponsored.
By who, Donald and Daisy?
Hey, you don't wanna be Ducks? You'd rather be District Five? Some stupid number?
Better than some stupid animal.
I'll have you know, Peter, that the Duck is one of the most noble, agile and intelligent creatures in the animal kingdom.
But they're wimpy!
They don't even have teeth.

Neither do hockey players. Have you guys ever seen a flock of ducks flying in perfect formation? It's beautiful. Pretty awesome the way they all stick together. Ducks never say die. Ever seen a duck fight? No way. Why? Because the other animals are afraid. They know that if they mess with one duck, they gotta deal with the whole flock. I'm proud to be a Duck, and I'd be proud to fly with any one of you. So how about it? Who's a Duck?

[pause]
I'll be a duck.
Yeah, me too.
SHUT UP! You guys stink! I thought we came here to play hockey.

[sarcastically]
You know, I knew we forgot something.
Could you turn down the stereo?

[drunkenly]
Sure. I guess it was a 'widdle' noisy.
A 'widdle'? OK, I'm taking down to precinct. Breath, blood or urine?

[drunkenly]
No, thanks. I'm full.

Why'd you turn against me, Gordon? For six years, I taughtcha how to skate, I taughtcha how to score, I taughtcha how to go for the "W". You could have been one of the greats! An' now look at yourself. You're not even a has-been. You're a never-was.
Be careful man, it almost hit me that time!
Goldberg, you're the goalie. It's supposed to hit you.
Does that sound stupid to anyone else?
[Coach Bombay has taped Goldberg to the goal]
My mother is not gonna approve of this, Coach! She wants me to live to be Bar Mitzvah'd!
This is your Bar Mitzvah, Goldberg. Today, you become a man.
No. I think you've got the ceremonies mixed up. This is more like a CIRCUMCISION.

You may make it. You may not. But that doesn't matter, Charlie. What matters is that we're here. Look around. Who ever thought we'd make it this far. 1 2 3 Triple Deke. Take your best shot. I believe in you, Charlie. Win or lose.
Thanks coach!
Go get em.
A team isn't a bunch of kids out to win. A team is something you belong to, something you feel, something you have to earn.
I hate hockey and I don't like kids.
What's this supposed to be, a pep talk?
I'm sure this will be a real bonding experience. One day, maybe one of you will write a book about it in jail.
Did you really Quack at the Principal?
Yeah.
Are we Ducks or what?
Mom isn't gonna like this at all!
So what! If you want me to figure skate then you gotta play hockey!
What do I know about hockey?
[she knocks him down and skates away]
More than you think.
You know, she has many fine qualities that men find attractive.
I'm aware Charlie, that fact has not escaped me.
[Gordon has just been fired]
Yes sir, Mr. Ducksworth. Thank you very much, Mr. Ducksworth. Quack, quack, quack, Mr. Ducksworth!
Gordon, stop quacking!
Quack, quack, quack, quack, quack!

[imitating Rob Schneider]
The Pete-Meister, Mr. Rabble-Rouser! Passing the puck over to Jessie-Roonie, the Enforcer!
[Peter falls down]
Ouch! That hurt! Oh, it's the Connie-Meister...
[Connie shoves Averman down]
...the Velvet Hammer.

[the team leaves him tied to the net]
Hey, guys! Excuse me, guys, you gotta untie me now! Ha ha! Good joke. Very funny. I like it. No joke, c'mon, guys.
[starts skating with the net still attached]
Hey, coach! Coach, c'mon, don't leave me hanging like this! Coach, don't make me come after you, coach!

[after blocking a shot with his head knocks him senseless]
I don't want to go to school today, Mom.
Karp, how many fingers am I holding up?
He wouldn't know that, anyway.
Shut up, Peter.
What about the things you said, you said we didn't deserve to live.
Karp, I was being sarcastic do you know what that means?

[sarcastically]
Noooo.
Okay, then you do.
Look, Mr. Zen Master, you may be in tune with the ice universe, but when it comes to my kid, "I just know" doesn't cut it!

Yo dude! You obviously in the wrong hood. This is my dominion, and it's a drug free zone. You understand? Now I'm feelin' generous today. So I'm gonna let you get your sorry vanilla booty out of here before we be usin' your eyeballs as hockey pucks!
You think losing is funny?
Well, not at first, but once you get the hang of it.
We're the ones out there gettin' our butts kicked.
Yeah, it's not like you coach us or anything. At least we tried.
Do me a favor. Kick some Hawk butt.
[about Terry, Guy and Jesse]
What's this? The Oreo line?

[talking about Casey's date life]
So what kind of guys does she date?
Jerks. Not because of her, but when they take a glimpse of me, POW! WARP SPEED! They are gone!
Don't take it personally, Charlie.
Oh, I don't care, except it's not fair to my mom.
Take the fall! Act hurt! Get indignant!
You got somethin' to say to me, Bombay?
To think, I wasted all those years worrying about what you thought. You're going down, Reilly.
Rink's gotta be around here someplace.
Just look for a sign that says 'Personal Hell'.
[under his breath]
How can he do this to me? I hate kids. They're barely human.
Is there a goalie?
Only for a little while. I'm moving back to Philly with my mom.
Thank you for sharing that.
Oh, man. It's my mom. She looks pissed.
[Bombay shoves him down]
Thank you very much, Mr. Ducksworth! Quack Quack Quack Quack Quack, Mr. Ducksworth!

You didn't listen to a word I said. I said keep your heads up, you put your heads down. I SAID HUSTLE, YOU WENT SLOWER. That was the sloppiest playing I've ever seen! Why the hell don't you just listen to me?
Why the hell should we?
I don't care. You wanna lose? Fine. You're the ones who look like idiots out there.
Look at this!
[shows Bombay Karp's dented helmet]

[as Rob Schneider]
The Karpster used his head to stop the puck, Mr. Karpelandi!
Concentration, not strength.
Like the Karate Kid, right? Wax on! Wax off!
Just shut up and try it, Averman!
I hate kids. They're barely human.

[Gordon has defeated Frank at court]
You really stooped to an all-time low on this one, Bombay.
I'm insulted by that, Frank, you have no idea how low I can stoop.
I mean, I don't mind losing; I'd just like to lose fairly.
Losing fair is still losing, Frank. Gotta go for the "W" every time!
And what about justice, huh? That man, he should be in jail.
It was your job to put him there, so don't take it out on me! Next time do your job, Franky-Boy.
Because it's not worth winning if you can't win big!
Just so you know, we really suck.
Hey, I'll decide who sucks around here.
[Cut to the kids playing, badly]
They really suck.
Keep swingin'. Maybe you'll give them a cold.

[as the kids horseplay in the car]
I could kill one of them just to set an example, sir!

[after Bombay ties him to the net]
My mother would not approve of this, coach. She'd like to live to be Bar Mitzvahed.
This is your Bar Mitzvah, Goldberg. Today, you will become a man.
Coach, I think you got the ceremonies mixed up. It's more like a circumcision!

[referring to a duck]
But they're wimpy!
They don't even have teeth!
Neither do hockey players.

[shaking Peter upside down]
Give me my candy! That's it! All of it!
[McGill has just viciously cross-checked Adam into the net, knocking him unconscious]
What did you do?
My job
